messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] books  on horses
messages.msgSnippet: Not books about horses, but don t forget about Judy Blume. Great for the pre-teen set. Amy ... From: tracy.oldfield@ntlworld.com To:
messages.messageBody:
Not books about horses, but don't forget about Judy Blume. Great for the pre-teen set.
Amy
----- Original Message -----
From: tracy.oldfield@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Sent: Thursday, June 01, 2000 11:59 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] books on horses

On 31 May 2000, at 7:33, Campbell & Wyman wrote:

 Who is the author and who is the publisher of these books please.  Could you tell me a bit more about them? My daughters are really into horses these days but are strong readers (9 and 11) and like well-written books. Ta,  Brooke in B.C.  brynlee@...


I used to like the Silver Brumby books, I can't remember the author, Eileen Mitchell? But I can't remember how old I was when I read them <g>

Tracy

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] books  on horses
messages.msgSnippet: OOh, yes, always Marguerite Henry comes to mind, but also all the Enid Blyton series books as well - just think _british_ authors for a great selection of
messages.messageBody:
OOh, yes, always Marguerite Henry comes to mind, but also all the Enid
Blyton series books as well - just think _british_ authors for a great
selection of books on horses Brooke! ;-)

Chapters has about 20 books with Black Stallion in the title :-)

Lorraine

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] books  on horses
messages.msgSnippet: Your daughters would probably love all the Marguerite Henry books., King of the Wind being the most famous. Will you at the BC homeschool convention -- if
messages.messageBody:
Your daughters would probably love all the Marguerite Henry books., "King of
the Wind" being the most famous.

Will you at the BC homeschool convention -- if so, I look foward to meeting
you.

david
